title: Recent Progress in PEG-Based Composite Phase Change Materials
description: This review addresses the latest developments in polyethylene glycol (PEG) as a phase change material (PCM) for energy storage and thermal regulation.

title: Recent Advances in Modified Commercial Separators for Lithium–Sulfur Batteries
description: This review addresses the latest developments in nanofiber-based separators for lithium-sulfur batteries.

title: Recent Development in Novel Lithium-Sulfur Nanofiber Separators: A Review of the Latest Fabrication and Performance Optimizations
description: This review addresses the latest developments in modified commercial separators for lithium-sulfur batteries, focusing on the effects of various modifications on the separator's performance and the overall battery performance.

title: Review on thin-film nanocomposite membranes with various quantum dots for water treatments
journal: Journal of Industrial and Engineering Chemistry
description: This review addresses water treatment using thin-film nanocomposite (TFN) membranes incorporated with various quantum dots (QDs), focusing heavily on dye removal and membrane antifouling.

title: Recent Advances in the Nanomaterials, Design, Fabrication Approaches of Thermoelectric Nanogenerators for Various Applications
description: Given that the TE material is a key component in TENGs, this review highlights how to optimize other vital parameters for applications in wearable electronics, sensors, solar energy conversion, and waste heat recovery.

title: Rapid optimization of 3D printed sediment microbial fuel cells
journal: International Journal of Energy and Environmental Engineering
description: Various SMFC parameters, including sediment moisture, the presence of a water layer, the use of a proton exchange membrane (PEM), and electrode separation, are investigated using SMFCs designed for reliable and rapid testing.

title: Carbon-Based Quantum Dots for Photovoltaic Devices: A Review
description: The application of carbon quantum dots (CQDs) in various components of photovoltaics and solar concentrators is discussed. The synthesis of CQDs and their benefit to power conversion efficiency is highlighted

title: Modification Strategies of Membranes with Enhanced Anti-biofouling Properties for Wastewater Treatment: A review
description: This review addresses composite membranes used for wastewater treatment, focusing heavily on the anti-biofouling properties of such membranes.

title: Recent Development in Vanadium Pentoxide and Carbon Hybrid Active Materials for Energy Storage Devices
description: This review discusses the development of various V2O5/carbon hybrid materials, focusing on the effects of different synthesis methods, V2O5/carbon compositions, and physical treatment strategies on the structure and electrochemical performance of the composite material as promising supercapacitor electrodes.

title: Problem-Based Learning: A Case Study Demonstrating the Benefits of a Post-Freshman Summer Invention Program on Thermal Fluid Sciences Engagement and Professional Development
journal: ASME International Mechanical Engineering Congress and Exposition
description: This case study follows a student who experienced a reversed pedagogy, wherein pure PBL instead of traditional lectures drove TFS education. The case study involves the study of CFD via an invention that improves airflow in connected rooms even while the door is closed

title: Recent Advances in Layered Double Hydroxide-Based Electrochemical and Optical Sensors
description: This review discusses standard LDH synthesis methods, design and modifications of LDH-based materials, and the different electrochemical or optical analysis techniques available for LDH-based sensors.

title: Review on Colloidal Quantum Dots Luminescent Solar Concentrators
description: This review appraises the latest developments in colloidal QDs—basic QDs, doped QDs, core/shell QDs, hybrid QDs, and Si-based QD—for their applications in LSCs. Other factors that enhance an LSC's efficiency, such as altering the polymer matrix and using distributed Bragg reflectors, are discussed.

title: Study on the Optoelectronic Behavior of Zr Based MOFs Using Computational Simulations
journal: IEEE Annual Computing and Communication Workshop and Conference (CCWC)
description: The research focuses on studying the behavior of MOFs(Metal Organic Frameworks) used in optoelectronic device. Computational simulations and chemical programs have been employed to figure out the stability and efficiency of the MOF particles in the device.
